Update Review-31st March 2025
Now that Ramadan sadly has just passed, hence my feedback on my many patronage to Masjid Muhajirin, among other mosques.

I'm deeply impressed by the dedication of the volunteers.  Haji Alex( pictured in red shirt) and Haji Hussain( pictured in white top standing), in particular, fostered a welcoming and inclusive environment for all worshippers, regardless of background. Their attentiveness, including Haji Haron, Haji Omar and Encik Nasrin was remarkable; noticing me not having my Iftar(only korma and water consumed) due to personal prayer I want to achieve, they thoughtfully saved food for me.  The  foreign volunteers, mainly Bangladeshis, displayed exceptional commitment, their selfless service truly inspiring.

Ustaz Ashraff's unwavering support and helpfulness also deserve recognition. Ustaz goes beyond his duties and always ready to be hands on deck.

Finally, I was fortunate to meet and mingled with the honurable Chairman, Haji Zafran, a humble and insightful leader who values his staff and volunteers. His down to earth persona, genuine care and his people's managament will inspire all and hence it will make everyone want to contribute to his vision for Masjid Muhajirin's success.

Thank you Haji Alex/Hussain, and to all the volunteers.

Mr.Chairman Haji Zafran sir, thank you once again and wishing you more successes your vision deserves.

Selamat Hari Raya, Maaf Zahir & Batin.

Afwan,

Eddy (The Mosque Hunter)

Today's subject is about Merperhalusi Adab dalam Solat or Refining Our Etiquette in Prayer. I wont dwell more on it but lets respect others in attendance so we all can focus our our intentions to Allah swt. Every individual should and must adhere to what is being sermoned to us today. It is all about making effort and upbringing. Thank you Ustaz Ahmad Dahri.

Now back to our respected gentlemen that I mentioned in the begining. Encik Alex, as everybody is familiar with this name, always ensures the daily operations is of high standards, set up, all in attendance are comfortable, requests that he always try to accede to...I salute his efficiency in providing the total expereince for all of us attending prayers. Today Mr. Mike made an effort to provide me food after Isaa'h prayers as I was starving and weak üôè.

Masjid is a place of peace, calm and serenity( not noisy) that we devote our allegiance in Islam and Allah swt. But a bonus is the volunteers at the Masjid that makes the Masjid a place to welcome is in open arms. Someome you can talk to and ask for advice. Very approachable. Thank you Enciks, Nasrin, Omar and Ibrahim and Zahidüôè.

Located in Braddell Road, in Toa Payoh North area, Singapore.

This mosque is located in Singapore Islamic Hub. Macam masjid-masjid lain, masjid ini sepenuhnya tidak menggunakan aircond dan pengudaraan air luar yg masuk dengan beberapa kipas bagi ventilasi kawasan.

The mosque is well ventilated.

There is bus stop nearby where you can take a ride from Bishan Interchange or Bishan MRT. I took a ride from Ang Mo Kio also can. Need to transfer bus la. Very convenience.

The parking got basement car park. Also got 3 level of praying area. Ground floor for men, 1st floor for women, then the upper level reserved for jemaah if crowded.

Nice place to pray terawih. Very good place. Got 2 projectors that will be projecting the info and ads for us like donation etc.

In Ramadan, fasting month, got makanan / food for berbuka puasa. But no moreh.

Rate: 8/10

The masjid has been re-built as part of the Singapore Islamic Hub development and was opened to public in January 2009.

Masjid Muhajirin is the first masjid to be built under the Mosque Building Fund. Back then it was easily recognizable by its prominent dome and minaret at the entrance of the building.  Sited next to the Islamic Centre of the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore, it was completed in April 1977 with a capacity of 1400 people and serves Muslims of all ages living in Toa Payoh and Bishan.
